page.title: 19ATTITUDES AND OPINIONS
page.content: Inadequacies of public transport also commands an important role in peoples concern and opinions. In Rosewell, poor housing and high unemployment dominate. This old and decaying "Company town", built by the private coal company before Nationalisation in 1947 is in bad need of renovation and rebuilding. The N.C.B (National Coal Board) has done little, except board up houses as they fall vacant. Ownership of the land reverts to the leaseholder, Lothian Estates in a few years time, so nothing much is being done meanwhile. Now that the local coal mine and brickworks have ceased to operate, employment opportunites are scarce. Most of the working population travel elsewhere for work-such as Bilston Glen Colliery, or service industry jobs in Edinburgh,or closer at hand.
